review: I was interested in Sling TV and I needed just a bit more impetus to get me to try it out. I've been interested in the Fire TV and the TV Stick for tinkering purposes. The Stick worked great out-of-the-box and is quite zippy, especially compared to the Roku stick. Sling TV works great, as has any other streaming media we've thrown at it. The Fire TV and TV Stick are both notable because they are Android-based and you can use your computer to put additional programs and files on them through your local wireless connection. For example, I'm running the Firefox browser, a file system manager, a meta media collector/player, and a portable game console emulator. None of these appear the Amazon Appstore, but can be loaded and run nevertheless. Props for the remote, too... simple to use and very responsive. Would probably buy another but our Roku stick will suffice for now. Great job!
author: Amazon Customer "byte_man"
